intro: Hermannia geniculata, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, often in the axils of the leaves. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly rough texture. Hermannia geniculata is often grown as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of indoor conditions.
